snippet: Japanese automakers have cut manufacturing by up to half in China after violent anti-Japanese protests over disputed islands in which Japanese-brand cars and even their owners were targeted.
abstract: Japanese automakers suffer plunging sales in China and cut manufacturing in that country by up to half amid violent anti-Japanese protests against Japanese-brand cars and even their owners; protesters are demonstrating over a territorial dispute between the two countries.
lead_paragraph: Japanese automakers have cut manufacturing by up to half in China after violent anti-Japanese protests over disputed islands in which Japanese-brand cars and even their owners were targeted.

headline.main: In China Protests, Japanese Car Sales Suffer
headline.print_headline: In China, Sales Fall as Political Uproar Hurts Japanese Carmakers
